ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take the senior essay. Definitely if you want to do graduate school, but even otherwise I think the senior essay really pulls together everything you have learned over four years.

In the words of a great man, "A lot of you may be wondering 'why should I write an essay'. But let me ask you: how DARE you even consider not taking advantage of the privilege of working with a professor in this economics department."
The Senior essay is really what you make of it. If you don't need it for a future research degree and are burdened during your senior year, I wouldn't necessarily suggest doing one.

NO! I received no support from my adviser, and when I sought help the University would not provide a tutor. The department provided no support and I believe that this is a serious problem which needs to be addressed.

Yes! The senior essay is a chance to use all of the tools, theories, and information that you have accumulated over the past 3 years and to work with a member of the faculty. I found the essay to be the most rewarding experience at Yale so far and hope that everyone finds it to be a similarly enjoyable experience. As long as you pick a helpful adviser, the essay will turn out well!

Do it, and do it all year. I was not an all-star econ major, but I really loved working with my advisor. Try to see them all semester. I only saw mine frequently toward the end, and I regret not doing it earlier. The end of the paper gets a bet stressful but it's definitely worth it, and the whole experience is pretty chill until then.

I would recommend that every econ student do a Senior Essay. It's required for almost every other major so I honestly don't know why Econ students get away with not having to do one. I personally feel that before one can truly call him/herself an econ major, he or she should have done some sort of meaningful econ research and the Senior Essay is the best way to do that.
